title: Unit 3 Sec 5: Respiratory System
description: Tests on respiratory physiology, infection control (TB), and emergency care (Asthma).

questions.question: Which of the following is a medical emergency defined as a severe asthma attack unresponsive to conventional therapy lasting >24 hours?
questions.explanation: Status Asthmaticus is a life-threatening episode of asthma.

questions.question: What are the correct nursing actions for a patient with an Underwater Seal Drainage (Chest Tube)? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Keep the bottle below chest level
Clamp the tube vigorously every hour
Observe for oscillation (fluctuation) in the tube

questions.explanation: Never clamp tubes routinely or raise the bottle above chest level as this causes backflow. Oscillation indicates patency.

questions.question: The total volume of air that can be forcibly expired after a maximal inspiration is called ___BLANK___ Capacity.
questions.explanation: Vital Capacity = Tidal Volume + Inspiratory Reserve + Expiratory Reserve.

questions.question: Which bacteria is the primary cause of Tuberculosis?
questions.explanation: TB is caused by the acid-fast bacillus Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
